class_notes:
Final Assessment: Scheduled In-Class Exam
PRE- or CO-REQUISITES: Constitutional Criminal Procedure: Investigations (can be taken concurrently)
This course is eligible to be counted towards the requirements for the J.D. concentration in Criminal Litigation.
course_description: This class is designed to be a workshop to teach practical skills in the area of pre-trial federal criminal litigation. You will  practice both oral and written advocacy skills, and in the process learn how to develop persuasive case theories and pretrial strategies.
sections: Class Nbr: 5200, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 5:30-8:30p, Instructor: A. Prout, Status: Open
